Hi,
I want to use the Assume class to dynamically turn off some tests. Ther=
e are tests I want run when we run full regression but not at other times. =
I have implemented an assume line that I thought would ignore the test as f=
ollows
String buildType =3D System.getenv(BUILD_TYPE);
Assume.assumeNotNull=
(buildType);
Assume.assumeTrue(buildType.equals(DAILY_BUILD));

The test ru=
ns and exits when it reaches the assumeNotNull as I expected. However when =
all my tests finish I get an error in the junit report
build.xml:1100: Juni=
tTests failed. Check "C:\DEV\junitreport

Inside of the report I have the f=
ollowing

          <error message=3D"got: <[null]>, expected: each n=
ot null" type=3D"org.junit.internal.AssumptionViolatedException">	at com.My=
Code.InclusionFileProcessTest.testLoadLargeListbyId(InclusionFileProcessTes=
t.java:352)
</error>

To me ignoring the test would mean just that, nothing=
 happens. Am I doing something wrong? I have recently upgraded from junit 3=
